Subject:Re: Surprise!
Message 2225 of 4024
You asked that I speak with the professionals that say I’m crazy. Please let me know who they are so I can engage. I would like to consider their honest,
unprofessional feedback. Please don’t ignore this mail, please just tell me who they are so I can speak with them.
Sent:03/20/2024 at 04:19 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/20/2024 at 09:47 AM)
Subject:Re: I still do stupid things..
Message 2226 of 4024
I did not say crazy.
I said the therapists we/I have spoken to over course of many years raised serious concerns regarding conduct and safety.
Me and kids are now engaged with therapists to address the impact on overall mental and emotional wellbeing, how to heal, and how to structure
future support to be safe.
In regards to Therapists that raised serious concerns. There was a variation of feedback strongly advising the need for legal police intervention.
How to structure plans moving forward is now being directly addressed to ensure complete safety.
Conversation with Kari after the meeting with Adrian was heartbreaking. What he communicated to her in an honest and open environment was
incredibly brave and I need to respect and frankly have no choice but to take action on his own expressed words. She made it clear to me if she believes
he is in, or put in an unsafe situation, she must take action. That is her obligation.
This is similar to the obligation Yurishka was put in. You have a different perspective, but professionals have a duty to act when they are made aware
of certain situations.
AnnaLisa will be talking to Lisa. How we move forward will be dependent on how you receive the information and what you believe will be in best
interest of boys. We will see.
Sent:03/20/2024 at 10:06 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/20/2024 at 10:27 AM)
Subject:Re: I still do stupid things..
